Error Handling in R

Some simple examples

Let’s start by making an error.

plot(c00rs)
Error in eval(expr, envir) : object 'c00rs' not found
plotit <- function (x)
  plot(x)
plotit(c00rs)
Error in eval(expr, envir) : object 'c00rs' not found

Note that this function doesn’t make sense if the input is negative.

scaleme <- function (x, sf) {
  x/sqrt(sf)
}
scaleme(1:10,-3)
Warning in sqrt(sf): NaNs produced
 [1] NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN

This produces a NaN. That might be a problem as we might not notice that there is a problem until several calculations down the line.

Can check for negative scale factor and provide a more informative error message.

scaleme <- function (x, sf) {
  if (!is.numeric(sf) || sf <= 0) 
    stop("Expected sf to be a positive number, got ", sf)
  x/sqrt(sf)
}
scaleme(1:10,-3)
Error in scaleme(1:10, -3) : Expected sf to be a positive number, got -3

Or maybe, just issue a warning and let the NaN go through

scaleme <- function (x, sf) {
  if (!is.numeric(sf) || sf <= 0) 
    warning("Expected sf to be a positive number, got ", sf,"\n")
  x/sqrt(sf)
}
scaleme(1:10,-3)
Warning in scaleme(1:10, -3): Expected sf to be a positive number, got -3
Warning in sqrt(sf): NaNs produced
 [1] NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN

R Options for handling warnings.

Setting - options(warn=0) – Print warnings at end of function. - options(warn=1) – Print warnings as they happen - options(warn=2) – Stop on warnings

options(warn=1)
scaleme(1:10,-3)
Warning in scaleme(1:10, -3): Expected sf to be a positive number, got -3
Warning in sqrt(sf): NaNs produced
 [1] NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN NaN
options(warn=2)
scaleme(1:10,-3)

Adding a call to recover() where the error occurs will allow the programmer to look around at what is going on when the error occurs.

scaleme <- function (x, sf) {
  if (!is.numeric(sf) || sf <= 0) {
    warning("Expected sf to be a positive number, got ", sf,"\n")
    recover()
  }
  x/sqrt(sf)
}
scaleme(1:10,-3)
